"Organisms don't think of carbon dioxide as a poison. Plants and organisms that make shells, coral, think of it as a building block."[NEWLINE] - Janine Benyus[NEWLINE]
"Organisms don't think of carbon dioxide as a poison. Plants and organisms that make shells, coral, think of it as a building block."[NEWLINE] - Janine Benyus[NEWLINE]
"Organisms don't think of carbon dioxide as a poison. Plants and organisms that make shells, coral, think of it as a building block."[NEWLINE] - Janine Benyus[NEWLINE] <<<<<<< Updated upstream >>>>>>> Stashed changes ======= >>>>>>> Stashed changes
"In fact we can now prove that this crater is due to the collision with the earth of an extra-terrestrial body, possibly a small asteroid, which was presumably metallic in nature."[NEWLINE] - Daniel Barringer[NEWLINE]
"O snail, climb Mount Fuji, but slowly, slowly!"[NEWLINE] - Kobayashi Issa[NEWLINE]
"The Colorado plateau with its magnificent deep canyons and towering peaks has not been an environment particularly hospitable to man. It is a land of extremes: flat-topped plateaus and mesas or vertical-walled canyons; ice-draped peaks or desert sands; unbearable heat or arctic blizzards; great aridity or thundering rapids."[NEWLINE] - Donald L. Baars[NEWLINE]
"I saw with amazement that the island of Krakatoa lay completely burnt and barren in front of our eyes and that at four locations was throwing up large chunks of fire."[NEWLINE] - Johann Wilhelm Vogel[NEWLINE]
"Look round, my boys, and view how beautiful the Rock appears by the light of the glorious fire."[NEWLINE] - George Augustus Eliott[NEWLINE]
"It spouted at regular intervals nine times during our stay, the columns of boiling water being thrown from ninety to one hundred and twenty-five feet at each discharge, which lasted from fifteen to twenty minutes. We gave it the name of Old Faithful."[NEWLINE] - Nathaniel P. Langford[NEWLINE]
"There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age."[NEWLINE] - Sophia Loren[NEWLINE]
"I am rich Potosi, treasure of the world, king of all mountains and envy of kings."[NEWLINE] - First Coat of Arms of Potosi[NEWLINE]
"This is the ceremony that became the famous El Dorado, which has taken so many lives and fortunes."[NEWLINE] - Juan Rodriguez Freyle[NEWLINE]
"After long waiting, he was able to climb to the summit and contemplate the impression of the Buddha's foot. From the top he saw to the north west the kingdom of Ceylon and on the other side the ocean."[NEWLINE] - notes from the pilgrimage of Vajrabodhi[NEWLINE]
"When the Lord finished speaking to Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two tablets of the covenant law, the tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God."[NEWLINE] - Exodus 31:18[NEWLINE]
"After thus having instructed the godly ones Lord Brahma went away with in his wake the forefathers and the leaders of the people whom he took from his own place to the abode of Lord Shiva, Kailash, the best of all mountains that is so dear to the master."[NEWLINE] - The Bhagavata Purana[NEWLINE]
"Australia is the home of the largest living thing on Earth, the Great Barrier Reef, and of the largest monolith, Ayers Rock (or Uluru to use its now-official, more respectful aboriginal name)."[NEWLINE] - Bill Bryson[NEWLINE]
"I saw that old father Nile without any doubt rises in the Victoria Nyanza, and as I had foretold, that lake is the great source of the holy river which cradled the first expounder of our religious belief."[NEWLINE] - John Hanning Speke[NEWLINE]
"As it turns out, Mount Kilimanjaro is not wi-fi enabled, so I had to spend two weeks in Tanzania talking to the people on my trip."[NEWLINE] - Nancy Bonds[NEWLINE]
"With my own eyes have I seen the countless diamonds stored in Solomon's treasure chamber behind the white Death; but through the treachery of Gagool, the witch-finder, I might bring naught away, scarcely my life."[NEWLINE] - King Solomon's Mines, page 25[NEWLINE]
"I shivered in those solitudes when I heard the voice of the salt in the desert."[NEWLINE] - Pablo Neruda[NEWLINE]
"I shivered in those solitudes when I heard the voice of the salt in the desert."[NEWLINE] - Pablo Neruda[NEWLINE]
"The remains of some mighty fabric, hurled into desolation by a tremendous earthquake, or some other equally terrible convulsion of nature."[NEWLINE] - Philip Dixon Hardy[NEWLINE]
"The remains of some mighty fabric, hurled into desolation by a tremendous earthquake, or some other equally terrible convulsion of nature."[NEWLINE] - Philip Dixon Hardy[NEWLINE]
"No one remembers who climbed Mount Everest the second time."[NEWLINE] - Sir Edmund Hillary[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"If it is a shame to be the second man on Mount Everest, then I will have to live with this shame."[NEWLINE] - Tenzing Norgay[NEWLINE]
"Water, water everywhere, nor any drop to drink."[NEWLINE] - Samuel Taylor Coleridge[NEWLINE]
"Bermuda Triangle are much older than many people think. Ever since the earliest days of oceanic exploration sailors have witnessed strange sights."[NEWLINE] - C.R. Hale[NEWLINE]
"Bermuda Triangle are much older than many people think. Ever since the earliest days of oceanic exploration sailors have witnessed strange sights."[NEWLINE] - C.R. Hale[NEWLINE]
"Bermuda Triangle are much older than many people think. Ever since the earliest days of oceanic exploration sailors have witnessed strange sights."[NEWLINE] - C.R. Hale[NEWLINE]
"The emission of light from fire, lightning bolts, stars or living beings attracts the attention of any human being. In the case of bioluminescence the light has a strange glow, something magic and mysterious."[NEWLINE] - Cassius Stevani[NEWLINE]
"Welcome to Dallol, Ethiopia, where the air is toxic, the ground spits acid, and there is no fresh water!"[NEWLINE] - National Geographic TV[NEWLINE]

"We will go on spring days, we will go on winter, Mount Paektu, Paektu, home of my heart."[NEWLINE] - "We will go to Mount Paektu", North Korean anthem[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Until the East Sea's waves are dry, Mount Baekdu worn away, God watch o'er our land forever, our Korea manse."[NEWLINE] - "Aegugka", South Korean anthem[NEWLINE]
"Oddly, it appears not to be the scar of a meteorite but a deeply eroded dome, with a rainbow-inspired color scheme."[NEWLINE] - Chris Hadfield[NEWLINE]
"Oddly, it appears not to be the scar of a meteorite but a deeply eroded dome, with a rainbow-inspired color scheme."[NEWLINE] - Chris Hadfield[NEWLINE]
